one_reviews_text: I watched this and was awed by the detail and explanations given on the history of flight. My son also enjoyed the historical presentation of this VR experience, which was a plus in my books. Wished there was more inciteful VR eductional videos out there that i can get him to watch. Short in play time, no interaction but still worth the 5 stars as it was put together brilliantly.

This amazing display of wonderful aircraft brought me to cheers and tears, easily the most emotional experience I have ever had in VR (well, I confess to being an Air Force brat).  Totally wonderful and worth the time and money. I'd pay well for a lot more of this. I can easily see the educational potential as well as the aviation promotional value. I can't wait to share it with my Dad, who is a decorated Vietnam-era Air Force fighter pilot (named Smith, no less). I'd like to see the B-26 bomber, F-100 Super Saber, F4 Phantom, and T-38 Talon. And some cockpit view ride-alongs. So much potential. Thank you very much! Please continue developing this. You do the Service proud.  Blue skies!

review_title: One of the better educational VR apps
one_reviews_text: A great title for showing off your VR to first timers.
I absolutely loved it even if the logo at the end was kind of a jumpscare.

This is an EXCELLENT experience.  At Squadron Officer School we have used this to support lessons on air power and history. Two asks:
Have you considered a strictly military airpower?
And
Are you going to port this to the quest?

Yes, it is short, as others have mentioned but it`s free and really well put together. I really did enjoy this little gem, more please dev`s. This could be a on going theme. This opens no end of doors, a history of what ever you want. This could end up a really good educational series.

Yes it is short, and the edge of the world is very obvious.
But I've never had the slightest interest in Avaiation until watching this, the fact that it puts you right in the centre of the action is the best decision a developer has ever made, and the voiceover is excellent
This would only work in VR, with the sense of presence as the planes fly over you. A VR Essential

review_title: I want more, and that's a good thing!
one_reviews_text: I'm new to the world of oculus and this is the second spectator presentation I've seen, the first being the 1943 Berlin Blitz. This stuff is great, and I want more of it. As other commenters have mentioned, this experience is quite short. One wants to get off the tarmac with the narrator and see more of these spectacular vehicles and their history. If the authors happen to read this, then thank you. I'd love to see an expansion or continuation, and would be willing to pay for it as well.
As a lover of aviation and the history surrounding it, this experience made my jaw drop. To see the sheer number of planes involved in the Battle of Britain was truly awesome. Thank you for this.

It's a short VR presentation. And although I do not have much to do with flying and history, I really enjoyed it. A very pleasant voice and great presentation. Everyone should enjoy these few minutes. No reason to regret it.

review_title: Great example of a VR icebreaker
one_reviews_text:
Note: This is not a game, there is no interaction. It's a VR presentation.

This is a nice short experience which asks nothing of the viewer except to be able to turn your head from side to side.
I'm not a big plane nut or anything, but I found the level of detail to be quite striking and realistic.
There were some cool moments, like seeing a visual representation of all the german planes from the battle of britain. And also being able to see a concord flying at top speed.

All in all, it's a simple experience, well excuted. It's free, which makes it even easier to recommend.

review_title: Great intro to VR and history of flight
one_reviews_text: Would love to see this expanded and become interactive.

I had to stop reading some of the reviews because there are so many spoiled babies crying that it was "too short". It's free and it's awesome. The amount of work it takes to do this sort of thing is monumental, and again, it's free. I hope to see more products from this developer, especially anything aviation related. It's my #1 when I show my friends what VR is all about.
This is a very interesting experience, could be better but it's very well done. 5 stars.

This feels like a great passion project, it doesn't put you in a cockpit and is really short, but the presentation is very well done and captures some great aspect of aviation history.
And it's free! If you have 10 minutes to speare, give it a try!
Very nicely done, indeed!

I really wasn't expecting much. But this was actually a really well done educational flight experience. The graphics are above average and it's well-narrated. Definitely something to show off to anybody interested in the history of flight.

review_title: Cool History Lesson but Way Too Short
one_reviews_text: I love the historical VR experiences, and this one no exception. Just way too short. Takes more time to download than to watch it.  After eagerly watching the download meter, I was disappointed to fire it up and it last all of 5 minutes. Did enjoy it though.  Just wish there was way more to it.

review_title: Never was so much owed by so many to so
one_reviews_text:
"Never was so much owed by so many to so few "
The Battle of Brittain flyby was an amazing tribute to Great Britain's finest hour.
Very excellent demo length educational experience,  a quick spapshot about THE HISTORY of FLIGHT. Considering the small download, excellent graphics.

This is not the history of flight. It is the United States military's inaccurate history of aircraft mostly used in war,  a humantitarian atrocity. Even when civilian use aircraft are mentioned they are compared to US military aircraft and their long outstanding history is glossed over. A very sick military homage.  
I could not watch the film all the way through.  At the part where an aircraft flies over shooting very large caliber amunition at the observer, presumeably an unarmed civilian I removed my HMD in disgust. I cannot see how this product can be rated Everyone when there is a real life killing scenario.  Now I am looking how to delete an entry in my Oculus library.
review_feedback: Hi thank you for your feedback! The Everyone rating was updated to E10+ to reflect the inclusion of the Fokker Eindecker shooting sequence. There is only one American military aircraft in the experience, which is the F22 at the end, and there are only two featured military aircraft in the piece, if you include the German Fokker Eindecker (the French Bleriot and American DC-3/C-47 were used by the military but neither aircraft was armed). The WWII flyover sequence obviously also includes British and German warplanes but we intended it to be contextualized as an antiwar sentiment since it is supposed to show the scale of the destruction to the crewmen rather than as a celebration of the Battle of Britain. The remaining aircraft are all civilian and include the French-British Concorde and the Ukrainian Mriya heavy transport craft which is often used for humanitarian disaster relief missions.

one_reviews_text: Cool experience if you like aircraft. Great voice actor. Models are surprisingly well done for a free demo.
Well done quick overview of flight from the Wright Brothers to the jet aircraft of today. Would watch again.

review_title: Even as a freebie, not worth your time
one_reviews_text: Hate to write a negative review, but I can't really recommend this.  Watched it once, then immediately uninstalled.  Aircar, which is also free, does a much better job of showing off what VR is capable of.
for a freebee video, very good...short and sweet

review_title: Download now, great story, good graphics
one_reviews_text: This is great for first time time VR users.  You can sit them down and hit play.  They truly get a sense of what VR is all about.   Graphics for me were good, but compared to the game Lone Echo, the graphics could be a lot better however does not change the fact that this is a great story and a highly recommeded download.
I served 24 years in the Air Force and this put a smile on my face.  Great job guys!
If you're bored and looking for a quick little thing to watch, this is it. You can sit down in awe and just watch the history of aviation fly over you in only a few minutes.
It's free and fun. Really, you should stop looking for more comments and just try it.
Great narration, lovely to see. But the music can not be turned down. Also, as an oculus user,  the visual quality is terrible.
Actualy the first self powered aircraft was the 14 Bis made by a brazilian called Santos Dumont.

Experience was alright overall. Textures were a bit on the low side. Models should probably have had higher polygon amounts. But the  biggest isssue I had was everything from the narrator to the content was trying to make the impression that America is the only county worth mentioning when it comes to aviation. 
If it was an American aircraft they made sure to mention it. If not they glossed over it. Bit unimpressed.
Graphics are excellent! Must see!

review_title: Very moving, I cried man tears
one_reviews_text: It's too short.

You start off at Smiths Air Force Base with a Coronal Thompson. He will be your guide to all things flight, from the first to the biggest. We get to see the Wright Flyer, DC3 and even the F22 Raptor fighter jet puts in an appearance!

Of course, it is not all about just the planes here, but the stories and the history behind them. Full voice narrated it was more like the greatest airshow ever devised than a simple VR experience. The sounds, the sights and dare I say even the feel of these planes flying over you is something truly incredible. It's is not just a great VR experience, it is also a good educational tool for any class or individual learning about flights. Once again VR shows it’s strength when it comes to educational experiences and this is one of the very best of those experiences.

Nice little demo showing off some nicely modeled planes.  If I have any other friends or family who are fans of planes I may reinstall it again someday.  Good for a one off viewing, but after that no real replay value.  We need more virtual museums like this.
So typical for americans to put themselves in the best light... what about Gustave Whitehead or better: Henri Coanda who was the first pilot to  fly a plane whit jet propulsion system in 1910!
review_feedback: It was intended to be like an airshow you might see in Texas, but we did include non-American Bleriot, Fokker and BAE. It would be fun to do country specific versions of this to celebrate the achievements of different aviation communities. The jet age is a little fuzzy, there are also good arguments for starting with the He178 or Me 262, since they were turbojets with practical performance but I thought there were enough Nazi-era planes in there from the Battle of Britain sequence. I think the 707 was a good starting point because that's the plane that brought jet aviation to the general public (you could argue for the Comet too, but it didn't have the same impact because of the early crashes scaring off buyers).

one_reviews_text: This was a pretty cool little educational experience. It's worth checking out.
Beautiful graphics of the planes to introduce plane history.  Wish the sound worked.  Will hope for updates.

Cool presentation and good information about avaition history.  The sound worked great the first few time I ran the program, however, it randomly works.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled several times with the same issue.  Hearing about and seeing the number of planes shot down is touching....watching them fly overhead with no story isn't.  Please fix

You stand on a runway for this "experience" and about 8 different airplane models fly by while a narrator tells you a short quip about each one.  Pretty dull, no replayability. Airplane models are OK.  The only neat thing about it is seeing the scale of some of the planes since you are standing right next to most of them.
glad they fixed the audio because its pretty legit
Interesting and educational... but I was expecting to fly in one of the planes at the end.
Very nice combination between VR and aviation :)

review_title: brief and pretty history of flight
one_reviews_text: The production values is very high: narrator has a great voice, and many graphics details like the heat haze from the engines. Makes good use of VR by having the plains fly very close to you. Would totally watch more
Sound is bugged. It does not use the Rift headphones. Every other application defaults to the Rift headphones when launched via Oculus Home.
it could be better
This narration and aircraft display mode has tremendous potential. I hope developers will create much longer and richer experience based on this.
Must have!!

Proves education CAN be fun! Nice brief exploration of the history of flight, with realistically detailed models. Wish it had a "hangar" feature allowing you to "walk around" the parked airplanes, because some of them go by so fast they're hard to see.

It appears along with myself, many others are not getting sound. I use a different audio device than oculus. This is the only game that I've had audio trouble with. Seems like it would have been cool otherwise.
No sound
The audio defaults to the Rift headphones, but I don't use them. I can't find any option to change the audio device. Every other piece of software sends audio to my default device automatically.
Beautiful graphics, great narration, and fun to watch. Wish the demo would have taken up in the sky though!
No sound in my Rift headphones
I'm sure this is great but when in the headset it says this game will work with controller.  I installed it and could not use one.  Took off headset and there it says touch is required.
it looks great but without sound it useless.  not using the oculus headset but my own
I love this being retired USAF avionics tech I loved working on a few of these airframes. Now I really want to see an update with more aircraft showcased.

Excellent writing, animation, scoring and narration. Would have loved to hear a little more 3D audio and the airplane sounds roaring in your face like you do at a real air show,  But all in all 5 stars! Definitely evoked a sense of emotion and exhilaration.

Really enjoyed it, all too brief of course and wanted more.  The WWII flyover were missing the bombers, would have been nice to have a mixture in there.  Concord was great.  I know it's a RapidFire title but the quality is easily good enough to be expanded on for a longer experience.

This has just received an update and now works perfectly. For free content this is very nicely done and certainly worth watching. I would glady pay for further content with a greater choice of aircraft, maybe some internal views and walkarounds. Thank you developers.

Graphics might use some more detailed textures, horizon should have some terrain in the distance, real time shadows are also absent but nonetheless... it brought tear to my eye :)

music, sound and directory - top notch!
This is a great experience for anyone who is into flight and airplanes. Just wish it was longer and had more detailed aircraft.
just some simple plane models flyin over your head.  useless.
A really well-executed featurette. Bravo!
the sound bug is a mess...
A nicely presented little edu film. Had a nice sensation of presence, despite the relatively non-flashy graphics. Excellent at exhibiting the scale of these aircraft.
Simply awesome presentation of the aviation history. Almost cried out when the DC-3 airliner taxiing through.
As a flight enthusiast I really enjoyed this one. Brought a tear to my eye. Only wish I cuold have felt the rumble of the engines and smelled the jet fuel!
Very comfortable and well done brief review of aviation history.
Your dad will probably like it
Oh wow that was so good.  I only wish it was much longer a was enjoying it so much.
It only starts Steam VR.
Really enjoyable, only hoping it to be a bit longer.
The concept is nice but I'm left wanting more. How about going inside the planes? More view points?
As a pilot I really enjoyed this and would love to see this taken further and more in depth!
It ended too soon. This was so good.
As others have said - I wish it lasted longer.
Like others have mentioned it just launches Steam VR and won't run properly.
Nice concept. Of course could be longer and more in-depth but hey - IT'S FREE
That was so cool, I just wish it were longer :)
Poor visuals, rather short and not at all indepth....
Nice show.
Nice travel
dopeplanes
